required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Apatinib Plus Camrelizumab Combined With Docetaxel and S1 in First-line Treatment for Metastatic Gastric Cancer
clinical_study.official_title: Apatinib Plus Camrelizumab Combined With Docetaxel and S1 in First-line Treatment for Metastatic Gastric Cancer: HCCSC G05 Trial

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy and safety of Apatinib plus Camrelizumab combined with docetaxel and S-1 as the first-line treatment of metastatic adenocarcinoma of gastric and gastroesophageal junction.

primary_outcome.description: PFS is defined as the time from enrollment to the first documented disease progression or death due to any cause, whichever occurs first. Responses are according to the Response Evaluation Criteria in Solid Tumors version 1.1 (RECIST 1.1) as assessed by investigator

secondary_outcome.description: Defined as percentage of participants achievingassessed complete response (CR) and partial response (PR) by the investigator according to the RECIST 1.1.
OS is the time from enrollment to death due to any cause.
DCR was defined as the percentage of participants who have a confirmed complete response（CR） or partial response（PR） or stable disease（SD） per RECIST 1.1 as assessed by investigator

overall incidence of adverse events (AE); incidence of grade 3 or higher AE; incidence of severe adverse events (SAE); incidence of AEs leading to discontinuation of drug use; incidence of AEs leading to suspension of drug use.

arm_group.description: First-line treatment: Apatinib plus Camrelizumab combined with Docetaxel and S1 for six cycles. Maintenance treatment: Apatinib and Camrelizumab

intervention.description: Camrelizumab (200mg) will be given i.v. on day 1 of each 3-week cycle
Apatinib (250mg) will be administered orally once a day .
S1 (BSA<1.25 40mg, BSA >=1.25-<1.5 50mg, BSA >=1.5 60mg) will be administered orally twice daily on days 1-7 of each 3-week cycle
Docetaxel (75mg/m2 IV.drop) will be administered on day 1 of each 3-week cycle, for six cycles.
